results.title: The Making of 'Silent Running'
results.creator_credit: Chuck Barbee, Thomas Piskura and Chuck Barbee Productions
results.brief_description: Presents a behind-the-scenes look at the people and technology needed to produce the film “Silent running”. Gives a close look at the work of director Douglas Trumbull, star Bruce Dern, singer Joan Baez, the editor, cameraman and others. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chuck Barbee, Thomas Piskura and Chuck Barbee Productions

results.title: The Magic machines & other tricks
results.creator_credit: Bob Curtis, Joan Keller Stern and Fly-By-Night Productions
results.brief_description: The work of Robert Gilbert, sculptor, we hear his voice as the camera examines his work, his tools and the leftover junk and objects which he assembles into his colourful kinetic sculpture. We see the work displayed in various places - on a truck riding along the freeway - in an elevator and in one painful sequence at Century Plaza, Los Angeles where we see “MACHINE JUNE 23”, work which commemorates the brutal confrontation between police and demonstrators on that day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Curtis, Joan Keller Stern and Fly-By-Night Productions

results.title: The Magic house
results.brief_description: Two parents abandon their responsibilities: at first their children are happy with this but over several days the attitude of the girl changes. Open-ended film which leaves many possibilities for discussion. Good for values study. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Magic fiddle
results.creator_credit: Michael Forlong, Jon Mathisen and Norway. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A Norwegian ballet based on one of the old folk tales of Norway. A peasant boy gives away his last shilling to a beggar who turns into a magician and gives him a magic fiddle which, when played, makes everyone dance. Features the Norwegian Ballet and the choreography of Gerd Kjolaas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Forlong, Jon Mathisen and Norway. Ministry of Education

results.title: The Machine: master or slave
results.creator_credit: Walter Niebuhr and Educational Film Institute of the New York University
results.brief_description: Considers the problems that management faces in its approach to the human and financial facctors involved in technological progress. To what extent can unemployment be relieved by seeking larger markets, by adjustment of prices, wages, and dividends? How can management co-ordinate its own long-term self-interest with the needs of the workers and the consumer? Instead of attempting to answer these questions, the film poses them against the background of managerial organisation, asking the audience not to overlook the realities involved.

results.title: The Lost wax method of bronze casting
results.creator_credit: Leo Steiner, Fotosonic and Harmon Foundation
results.brief_description: Vincent Kofi, a Ghanian sculptor, is shown making a bronze casting of his “Awakening Africa” using the lost wax method. The process - from modelling the original clay figurine to the finished work on the metal casting - is shown.

results.title: The Long distance search for the great Australian funny bone. - Edited version
results.brief_description: A variety of yarns and tall stories are told in this edited version of the search for the key to Australian humour. Includes animated sequences. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
